Course Name: Introduction To The Study Of Literature
Course Description: Develop and encourage the students to grow and evolve through the literary journey Expose the students to a range of literary genres (involving both fiction and non-fiction): poetry, drama, novel and short story Introduce the students to a wide range of writings of authors from different cultures and ages across the world To sensise students to some of the important common social issues which writers of different backgrounds have examined.

Course Outcomes.CO1: The student understands how literature provides a window to comprehend the society.
Course Outcomes.CO2: The student is able to interpret texts using the process of literary analysis for all the 3 main literary genres namely prose, poetry and drama.
Course Outcomes.CO3: The student is able to appreciate what makes a work of literature worthy and important - common social issues which authors in spite of their different backgrounds often examined.
Course Outcomes.CO4: To sensise students to some of the important common social issues which writers of different backgrounds have examined.
